name: Almond Butter Salted Caramel Brownie French Toasts
description: Almond Butter Salted Caramel Stuffed Brownie French Toasts! The brunch to remember. Slices stuffed with nut butter, date caramel. Vegan Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 2 tbsp flour (white or wheat or glutenfree(rice or chickpea))
9 to 10  soft medjool dates (soaked in hot water for half an hour)
Creamy almond butter or peanut butter
6 to 8  Bread slices, home baked ( or artisan or french bread)
vegan chocolate ganache (or melted vegan chocolate )

recipeInstructions.text: Blend everything under brownie batter. Pour into a shallow bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Blend everything under brownie batter. Pour into a shallow bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Blend everything under salted date caramel until smooth, Add more non dairy milk if needed. Taste and adjust salt and sweet. Add a touch of sugar or maple if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Blend everything under salted date caramel until smooth, Add more non dairy milk if needed. Taste and adjust salt and sweet. Add a touch of sugar or maple if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread almond/peanut butter on a slice of bread. Spread date caramel generously on the other slice. Combine the 2 slices into a sandwich. (You can also use fruit preserves instead of salted caramel for a PBJ filling)
recipeInstructions.name: Spread almond/peanut butter on a slice of bread. Spread date caramel generously on the other slice. Combine the 2 slices into a sandwich. (You can also use fruit preserves instead of salted caramel for a PBJ filling)

recipeInstructions.text: Place the sandwich into the brownie batter, flip after 10 seconds and soak the other side.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the sandwich into the brownie batter, flip after 10 seconds and soak the other side.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook on a heated and greased pan for 2 to 4 minutes each side. Repeat for the rest of the french toasts. Store the french toasts in the oven at a minimum setting to keep warm until ready to serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook on a heated and greased pan for 2 to 4 minutes each side. Repeat for the rest of the french toasts. Store the french toasts in the oven at a minimum setting to keep warm until ready to serve.

recipeInstructions.text: Drizzle more salted caramel and melted chocolate or chocolate ganache on the french toast. Dust with sugar (optional). Serve with favorite fruits.
recipeInstructions.name: Drizzle more salted caramel and melted chocolate or chocolate ganache on the french toast. Dust with sugar (optional). Serve with favorite fruits.
